intro: Monorchis coeloceras, commonly known as the spiral liverwort, is a type of non-vascular plant belonging to the family Marchantiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive spiral arrangement of leaves, which gives it a unique and recognizable appearance. This plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as on rocks or in damp soil. Its structure includes a thallus that is often lobed and can form dense mats. Monorchis coeloceras plays a role in soil stabilization and provides microhabitats for various small organisms.
